decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the opponent's board and resources by using various removal spells, creatures with value-generating abilities, and land destruction cards. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and tempo through cards like Solitude, Skyclave Apparition, and March of Otherworldly Light. Crucible of Worlds allows for recurring land destruction, while Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and answers to problematic artifacts. The deck utilizes a mix of control elements to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a one-on-one matchup.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and leveraging them for aggressive plays, using cards like Urza's Saga, Mishra's Bauble, and Mox Opal to generate extra value. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student help with card advantage and recursion, while Metallic Rebuke and Force of Negation keep opponents in check. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient artifact creatures like Thought Monitor and Kappa Cannoneer, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Portable Hole and Pithing Needle. The deck thrives on synergy and speed to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on using Allosaurus Rider to cheat out big creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier by sacrificing Disciple of Freyalise and using Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for them. Glittering Wish is used to search for specific combo pieces, while Consign to Memory can be used for removal or card draw. The deck has a toolbox aspect with a variety of creatures and spells to adapt to different situations. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. It also utilizes cards like Psychic Frog and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan. The deck is built around a powerful instant reanimator combo strategy, utilizing tools like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to cycle through the deck and find the necessary pieces to execute the combo.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, targeted discard, and removal spells while also utilizing creatures with disruptive abilities to maintain board presence. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and slowly grind them out through attrition, ultimately overwhelming them with its control elements. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas provides additional threats that can quickly close out the game if left unchecked. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's powerful spells.

The deck focuses on using control elements and ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures and extra turn spells. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal while quickly ramping into threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck also utilizes extra turn spells to generate card advantage and tempo. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent with Eldrazi creatures and powerful spells, while maintaining control of the game with counterspells and disruptive elements.

The deck aims to quickly cycle through its cards to fill the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield. This combo strategy allows the player to overwhelm their opponent with a board full of creatures, leveraging their graveyard as a resource. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Subtlety to control the game until it can execute its combo. The deck's goal is to consistently and efficiently execute the Living End combo to win the game.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on aggressive strategies to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes cards that provide additional value, such as Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer. By combining powerful creatures with burn spells and value cards, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to quickly ramp into powerful threats and finish the game. The deck includes various lands that generate multiple mana, along with cards like Explore and Arboreal Grazer to help ramp and fix mana. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional utility and synergy with the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature play, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off opponents. The inclusion of cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Thraben Charm provide additional value and flexibility in different situations. The overall strategy revolves around quick and efficient creature damage, backed up by removal and combat tricks to maintain board control and secure victories.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of card draw, counterspells, and powerful creature abilities to set up a game-winning combo using Goblin Charbelcher. By controlling the board with disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Suppression Ray, as well as generating mana with Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to quickly assemble the pieces needed to activate Charbelcher and deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes some versatile removal options and additional win conditions to adapt to different matchups.

The main idea of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counter spells and removal, while generating card advantage through card draw and card advantage engines. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominant board presence with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer. By managing the opponent's resources and carefully selecting when to deploy its own threats, the deck can outlast and outmaneuver its competition to secure victory.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End to control the opponent's hand and board, combined with aggressive creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Eldrazi Linebreaker, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. With a mix of disruption and beatdown, this deck is designed to take control of the game and never let go.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of red, green, and blue mana sources. The key strategy revolves around playing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. Leyline cards provide additional support and Leyline of the Guildpact boosts the power of multicolored creatures. Stubborn Denial offers protection while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can offer a game-winning effect. The mana base is diverse to support the deck's multicolored nature.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and spells. The deck utilizes low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to put pressure on the opponent early on. Goblin Bombardment provides additional reach, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker offer powerful effects to further enhance the deck's aggressiveness. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, this deck aims to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The core idea of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly ramp up mana with artifacts and utilize cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga to generate value and tempo advantage. By playing low-cost artifacts and controlling the board with removal spells like Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient plays. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student also provides card advantage and potential card selection, while cards like Mishra's Bauble help with digging through the deck for key pieces. The deck's strength lies in its ability to rapidly build a threatening board presence and apply pressure on the opponent.
